promptLog:
start conversation (use around 30 words don't use emoticons and don't wrap your answer with quotes) about a post titled `It should be socially acceptable for men to carry their own purses` it says `Between my phone, work phone, wallet, car keys, sunglasses, and the occasional phone/Apple Watch charger there’s a lot to carry around. Big leather computer bags are neat but take up too much space and are a bit pretentious for carrying the above listed items.

A small purse would be perfect. We don’t need to call it the man bag or the super satchel supreme to use it.

I hate having to have my wallet in my back pocket, it’s uncomfortable to sit on even if there are only few cards and some cash in it.

Phones are so massive anymore that it’s like carrying a brick in your side pocket, and then add the work one to it and now you got a giant block on your hip.`

my friend sent me this message please write a reply (use around 30 words don't use emoticons and don't wrap your answer with quotes)

The post highlights the need for socially accepting men carrying purses. Carrying essentials like phones, keys, and wallets becomes cumbersome. A practical solution without labels is advocated for.
